inclusion.criterion: Obese subjects - BMI at or above the 95th percentile for children of the same age and sex.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Pubertal: Testicular volume ≥ 6 ml Prader (M) and Tanner III breast development or greater (F)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: 12- 18 years regardless of gender, race or economic circumstance
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Pre diabetes/high risk of diabetes using criteria of HbA1C between 5.7 - 6.4% as defined by the American Diabetes Association (ADA)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: 25-OH vitamin D level less than 20 ng/ml (50 nmol/liter)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects must be willing to comply with study protocol requirements
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Treatment on medication known to effect vitamin D, calcium and glucose metabolism, such as glucocorticoids, thiazolidinediones, metformin, anticonvulsants metabolized through cytochrome P-450 (phenytoin, carbamazepine, phenobarbital, sodium valproate).
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Subjects will be excluded from the study if they have taken any form of vitamin D supplementation greater than 400 IU daily in the preceding 3 months.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Significant psychiatric illness: schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, active substance abuse, and uncontrolled major depression.
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 34-year-old obese woman who comes to the clinic with weight concerns. She has a BMI of 41.5 and is complaining of sleep apnea, PCO and dissatisfaction with her body shape.
